Name: Morning Star II
Description: The displaced long to rebuild the Old District into their new home, but evil clings like a shadow.
QuestDesc: The displaced long to rebuild the Old District into their new home, but evil clings like a shadow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Maji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Maji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Boy, am I glad to see you. My friends over at Ragunna told me they were sending some help over from the Order. I never expected it would be you. I'm relieved.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't you get promoted to management? Why are you still out in the field?

Dialogues.Speaker: Maji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, let's not put it like that. I'm still a courier at heart. When duty calls, I answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what kind of problem are we dealing with today that's got our Senior Regional Chief Advisor in a tight spot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Maji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One of our construction material convoys was attacked by TDs while crossing Mournfell Canyon. The Gladiators in charge of escort said they came across "undying monsters."

Dialogues.Speaker: Maji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right. They said those monsters would come back from the dead no matter how many times they killed them. They just wouldn't die.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Maji
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here are the coordinates. Best of luck to you!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency I'm getting from these monsters feels familiar and unpleasant. What do they want with those materials?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... Is this the underworld...? {PlayerName}, what are you doing here?! Could it be you're...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah—! Oh, no. No, no, no. That means Rinascita is doomed... Waaah...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm not dead, and neither are you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The disaster is over, and everyone's busy rebuilding.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, I'll show you. You can be part of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...No, no, {PlayerName}. I don't deserve to be part of that "everyone" you speak of.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I chose to fall into Dark Tide on my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blasphemous Fabricatorium, Acolytes colluding with terrorists, and the delusional Primus... What I feared is nothing compared to what I witnessed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They call it Salvation and Unity, but it's nothing but a descent into the abyss! A hollow lie that strips people of their will. The Order promises Ascension, yet they've long drowned in the very Dark Tide they claim to rise above!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Threnodian brought about disaster, but who brought about the Threnodian?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was the Order. It was me. I praised the false god's gospel, I turned a blind eye to the Fools... Now with innocents drowned by the Dark Tide, how can I stand on the shore with a clear conscience?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, {PlayerName}. I must answer for my sins... If it's to die by your hand...

Options.PlotLineKey: Death is only another way of escaping reality, Lenore.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you know that it was Medulius who saved you from the Dark Tide? He did it to thank you for your prayers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think of your parents who lifted you from the Dark Tide. The Acolytes who raised you. The Nimbus Sanctum ancestors who helped enlighten you. Even Medulius, who offered you a second chance.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are the continuation of all their hopes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lenore, it was Rinascita's kindness that carried you this far. This journey deserves a better ending.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Err. It amazes me how hard it is to argue with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lenore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand. Then please allow me to stay by your side for now, {PlayerName}.
Ah! Such proficient technique! The bravest warrior of them all! I never imagined we'd ever get another chance to see each other, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't think scaring off a bunch of cowards would be enough to attract the attention of the legendary {PlayerName}. Are you all that's left of Septimont's heroes now?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Medulius. You're alive?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I sincerely apologize if that comes as a surprise to you! So many warriors of Septimont perished under the Dark Tide, yet a lone gutless bastard like me still breathes the air. Ironic, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And for that, I have Lady Phrolova to thank! The curse that witch laid on me was so strong it ripped me out of the Dark Tide after the Threnodian was sealed, anchoring me within Mournfell Canyon so that I may live in eternal torment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess I'm not her favorite. Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But on the other hand, I've been given the luxury of bearing witness to a game more exhilarating and bloody than ever—I must be the most spoiled person alive.

Options.PlotLineKey: Septimont will not repeat the same mistakes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you? What gives you such confidence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But what if it wasn't a "mistake" to begin with?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even before the Dark Tide reached these lands, the Septimontians had deemed tavern fistfights the perfect entertainment. Blood and glory. Rust and burning sun—and men like me. We are the true colors of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What makes you so sure the receding tides reveal a fertile future and not a land soaked in blood?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about a wager, {PlayerName}? Which will come first: My cleansing by the eternal sun? Or the revival of the Bloody Agon?

Options.PlotLineKey: No need for the sun, I can do it myself. Right now.
I don't make wagers with monsters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, now, don't be such a killjoy, {PlayerName}. I can't harm a hair on you, and I'm sure you know I'm not so easy to get rid of. Why not settle this in a more dramatic fashion?

Dialogues.Speaker: Medulius
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which. Take a look at this "gift" I prepared for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Black water spews from the ground before vanishing just as quickly. In its place stands a girl—Lenore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The arrival of fresh supplies brings progress to the Old District's recovery effort.
